reviews.content: This is brilliant! I had heard people talking about this for ages before i finally decided to sit down and watch it, but im so glad i did. My first thoughts where 'Ow, it's in black and white, what good movies have ever been made in black and white?'then i thought to myself 'Raging Bull, Schindlers list, etc'. This is hilarious! And endlessly watchable. If you havent seen it i strongly suggest that you rent it out immediately!

reviews.review_title: Superb fast pace comedy, which bears all the hallmarks of a Kevin Smith film.
reviews.content: Shot over a period of only two days and for a budget of only $26,000, Kevin Smith delivers a feat of cinimatical achievement. This film is constantly funny (albeit sometimes crude) and never leaves the viewer bored or confused. Similar to the later film `Mallrats` which was shot on a much larger budget, but equally as hilarious. Overall I think the major achievement is how Kevin Smith did so much with so little.

reviews.review_title: Superb fast pace comedy, which bears all the hallmarks of a Kevin Smith film.
reviews.content: Shot over a period of only two days and for a budget of only $40,000, Kevin Smith delivers a feat of cinimatical achievement. This film is constantly funny (albeit sometimes crude) and never leaves the viewer bored or confused. Similar to the later film `Mallrats` which was shot on a much larger budget, but equally as hilarious. Overall I think the major achievement is how Kevin Smith did so much with so little.

Clerks is without a doubt in my top 5 films for one reason: its brilliant. The acting is fantastic and realistic and they make you care for the characters. The script is flawless with more memorable and hilarious moments than any other movie of the 90's. The movie is truly independent and there's nether any sign of hollywood style (black-and-white, no-plot, unusual plot), shcmaltz etc. It's incrediably entertaining as well and you'll wish it would never stop. The movie is also very thought provocking and intelligent as well. It's quite sad as well in a way but nether depressing. The thing I like about Kevin SMith is his way of making each of his movies into something different. 'Mallrats' his follow up was essentially a slapstick comedy (althogh it was undeniably very funny), while 'Chasing Amy' was a comedy-drama.However my second favourite of the 'Jersey' films is 'Dogma'. Whatever but Clerks is a must for anyone and a MUST - BUY

I watched this movie last week for the umpteenth time.  It gets funnier and funnier every time, and in a new and different way each time.  It's definitely a movie to watch when you feel like things can't get any worse. The struggles poor Dante goes through.  My goodness.  Having a friend like Randal to help him cope, which is no help.  This movie is a must see at least once.  After that you'll either watch it over and over or never again. You will have an opinion.

I personally think Clerks is one of the most original, bizarre and hilarious comedies to ever be released.  The other aspect of the film is that it was made in black and white on not even a shoestring budget.  Have'nt we all had bad days well after you watch this movie you think to yourself whoa I will never complain again.  With excellent characters all played marvelously this film is a must see for anyone except grandma.  Razor sharp humour along with comical genius makes Clerks an all time favourite on my list.

It wasn't the first of the Jersey Trilogy that I've seen but it should have been.  Not only because it IS the first but it is arguably the best.  I've never been a clerk but I've been in the same situation as far as being bored enough to analyze things up the ying/yang.  It was interesting to hear this dialog in an actual movie and to hear actual good points being thrown across.  Plus their sense of humor is right up my alley, and if your humor fits with it, you are a very rare breed.  Most people hate this movie but if they like it . . . they LOVE it.  Jeff Anderson, Brian O'Halloran and Jason Mewes turn vial cursing into tapestry of poetic mastery.  Never have I heard the "f" word used so intelligently.  Thanks kevin smith, for giving a fanboy something to admire.

reviews.review_title: A classic for movie purists everywhere.
reviews.content: Funny?  Yes, but not as side-splitting as South Park The Movie.  Brilliant storyline?  Yes, but not as intriguing as The Sting.  Is it worth watching? Yes, again and again and again.  When it was recommended to me and I began to watch it, I thought (being naturally pre-disposed to feel wary about black and white movies) that I wasn't going to enjoy it much.  I have hardly ever been so wrong. The acting is brilliantly natural, conveying the feelings of people who (and I include myself in this) have done jobs that they need, and are given, very little training or appreciation for. It's lack of commercial draw allows you to expect nothing when you begin to watch it (and it is also one of it's greatest advantages), so you can let yourself become totally involved in it's brilliance without feeling that you have to be enjoying what you are seeing.  But if you like stories and scripts, rather than effects and director over-elaboration (ie. Titanic), this is a must for you. But I'm not going to tell you, you have to like it!  See for yourself.

I caught this tawdry little vixen at Sundance the year it was released. What a homoerotic masterpiece! The drug addicts are SUPER FINE and paved the way for the retarded, yet foxy DELL GUY. In fact, it's little known that the DELL GUY in question actually serves as background fodder in several scenes (where's retardo?). It's fun to pause the tape and try to spot the idiot-boy. One hint; he's shirtless in TWO of his FIVE scenes. OOOHHHH LA LA!!! Anyhow, this piece of junk is extremely lowbrow and shows the work of below average film school dweebs. 5 OUT OF 5 CUPS OF BLEACH ( I CHUGGED THEM ALL!!!)

I first saw Clerks in 1997, at the age of 8. My English was terrible at this age but the movie made an impression in me. Today, I've watched it a well over 50 times and its always great.It's all about the dialogue. No fancy camerawork. But that's not needed and Kevin Smith shows it in this flick.

reviews.review_title: You'll either love it or wonder what all the fuss is about.
reviews.content: Clerks is very much a movie of it's time. Now a kid with an I-Phone would most probably produce something more technically proficient. Many of it's pop culture references are dated and at times the performances can feel undeniably stilted. It's also one of the best movies of the 90's-and for those of us who has worked as a store Clerk probably of all time. It might sound odd talking about a movie that is 80 per cent Star Wars and Dick jokes in such lofty terms but as with most great comedies, there is something deeper going on beyond the gags and banter. Themes of frustration, isolation and friendship are explored much more acutely and intelligently than many a po-faced drama attempting to tackle similar subjects. Highly recommended.

the liking of this film in no way relies on the lack of colour. it wasn't an artistic choice. rather one of cost. at $27,575 it is classed as no budget, but boy dids they stretch that thing.this is an incredible movie and is so perfectly written you cant bare to look away. although at first being rejected by miramax a massive response at Sundance '94 got them the distribution they deserved.Dante and Randall compliment each other completely and the array of customers (well i say array iots pretty much just walt flannigan but thats funny!) are equally riveting.the stupid questions, the angry customers, and a dead guy in the bathroom. what more could you want from a convienience store movie.kevin smith is a bonefide genius!!! the world loves ya smitty! PaUl:) xxx

Absolutely incredible! Possibly the best film I've ever seen done on such a small budget. Sure, the acting might not be as great as Mallrats or Chasing Amy, but it does no injustice to the script. In fact, the script, in all its pop-culture referenced glory, absolutely shines. A definite must-see.

reviews.review_title: Excellent film and one of my favorites!!
reviews.content: Kevin Smith created so much with so little. I love it!

oh man. i watched this movie twice in a row because it was so funny. although it is not one for the kiddies, it is still funny.  Jay and Silent Bob grace the screen with their genius and things get better from there. take a look at life how it really is, and see what kids today are really like.

reviews.review_title: A Classic, Smith at his best!
reviews.content: All i can say is that this movie is just the best. Anytime you can make a movie this damn good for as low as a budget as Smith did you are a genius. And Smith in this film is just that, a genius. This, folks, is Kevin smith at his best! He created a masterpiece when he created Clerks. The movie is a day in the life of a clerk. Simple concept, carried out greatly by smith. Smith and Jason Mewes(Jay and silent Bob) play great characters even though they do not say much! Go rent this movie, no buy this movie, and you will see why people love this movie, for its humor, although it may be explicit and gross at points. This movie, as i simply call it is a masterpiece! Be sure to check to the rest of the "Jersey Trilogy" for more great Kevin Smith Films!

Kevin Smith is a genius. The way he worked this movie provided the world with an off-the-wall hilarious dialogue and situation comedy, contrasted by hints of the serious deeper plot that held the movie together through it all. If you're searching for the 'catch-phrase' of this movie, look not to the classic 'i'm not even supposed to be here today', but to the subtle "a little word of advice...sometimes you gotta let the hard to reach chips go." Caitlin is definitely a hard to reach chip. 'nuff said. AWESOME MOVIE!!!

Clerks is a movie about a day in the life of two average schmoes who just happen to have some of the wildest craziest stuff happen to them.  Dante and Randle do the things all of us wish we could or would have done.  Kevin Smith is the master for off the wall comedy.  This is a movie that you can watch over and over and still pick up on something.  I laugh every time I have watched Clerks (seen it at least 20 times).

I saw Mallrats and laughed my a** off.  Then my friend told me, if you think that's funny you should see Clerks.  I took his advice and I was more than impressed.  Kevin Smith hid a deeper meaning behind a mask of humorous, grotesque, graphic, and hilarious dialogue.  The character development is brilliant despite the lack of acting ability.  If you are looking for a comedy which is authentic Generation X material with more humor than a truck load of one liners, this is film you should get into.

reviews.review_title: I'm not even supposed to be here today!-About the independent film classic
reviews.content: Kevin Smith indenpendent flick is a real classic.Sometimes it is very offensive (the "jizz-mopper")and vulgar (the f-word was justed lot),but this is the movie`s strengh because it feels like real life.The brilliance comes from its simplicity,which has a great meaning if you look deeper in it.The acting is not very stylish but it gives the film the touch of vividness to be different from the others.I think this is best of Kevins movies,because it has the weird,funny sexual talk in it,which is both dumb and intelligent.All in all Clerks has a heart which most of the other movies in the 90`ies do not have.It is important to be a person with an open mind to fully enjoy this flick.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies ever made
reviews.content: There's nothing more to say... Just check out the memorable quotes section. This movie is a good example of how to make an entertaining, witty and hilarious movie without it costing an arm and a leg. Watch out for the metal singer from Moscow... BERZERKER!

reviews.review_title: The Funniest & One of the Most Original Movies I've Ever Seen
reviews.content: Clerks is the funniest and one of the most original movies I've ever seen. Though it was shot with a low budget you don't notice because the jokes are hysterical and you are totally entranced---it had me "rolling" on the floor! You could sympathize with Dante throughout the whole film. Randal is hilarious and amazingly sexy! In my opinion it is Kevin Smith's greatest masterpiece! Do NOT miss it!!!!

Independent Movies are cool, Clerks is one of the best independent movies, it goes right there with Reservoir Dogs and Trainspotting, the dialogues is what makes this one a winner, Dante and Hicks have hilarious conversations, and Jay and Silent Bob are soooo funny (especially the scene with the russian who wants to be a metal singer), what sucks is that when an independent movie is good, hollywood smells profit and give the filmmakers a Big Budget to make a new movie. Like with Kevin Smith's Dogma, the movie has the Clerks-style humour, but with big names, while my favourite clerks-characters dante and randall say just one line in the entire movie, f*** off matt damon and ben affleck and that chick from Wild Wild West! so go and see Clerks!

What can I say Kevin Smith is a comic genius. The pace of Clerks and the banter between the actors is so natural that you feel as if you're actually listening on someone's life. Jay and Silent Bob are absolutely hilarious. The social commentary within the film is also done very well. I recommend this movie to everyone, but be warned the dialogue is not for the prudish. I've heard Kevin Smith be very critical of his films, but come on Mr. Smith, this movie just seems like it flowed so naturally onto the screen that it's almost sickening. Great film!

reviews.review_title: Talk about a rave review. No? Read one instead...
reviews.content: I don't mean to sound over the top but this surely has to be the funniest and cleverest film of the decade. Its testament to the razor sharp script and brilliant performances that a film with such low production values and aesthetic ineptitude can be so good. The black and white gives it a slightly arty, yet somehow not arty feel (if you know what i mean. Do you?); In fact, this is as far from an art film as can be. I would include my favourite quote if it weren't so "screamingly offensive". My second favourite - "I do not appreciate your ruse, ma'am" . I wonder whatever happened to Jeff Anderson (playing Randall). He created the most likable and witty character i have ever seen, the epitome of all that i deem cool if you like, with his simultaneously laconic and impassioned delivery. The script clinches it though. Surely Kevin Smith is a gift from god. Granted Mallrats was a bit lame but had its moments - "once i've kissed you, you're not the same as before - you're changed." and Chasing Amy was great until the melodrama took over (not that the melodrama was badly done, it just wasn't funny...obviously). I've not yet seen Dogma although i'm told its disappointing. But if Kevin Smith wrote the dialogue then there cannot fail to be good moments. In theory... Anyway, Clerks is perhaps my favourite film ever. Well, of the nineties. It deserves nothing less than 10/10. So thats what i gave it.

reviews.review_title: Kevin Smith akin to Kubrick for the ears?
reviews.content: I, like many people, loved Clerks, primary for its uproarious dialogue. Smith seems to me to be like Kubrick in one respect; they both are perfectionists in a single aspect of their work.  For Kubrick it's always the visual sense, primarily the use of lighting in his scenes.  Smith's focus, of course, is dialogue.  Both have also had their successes and failures, and I think these happen mainly when their perfectionism drives them too far away from their audience.  Kubrick with Eyes Wide Shut and Smith with Mallrats are in this light both excellent examples of the same problem, an intense focus on one aspect of moviemaking leading to inattention or a lack of concern for others.  Both of these directors (Kubrick when he was alive) know and knew of their deficiencies.  Smith is admittedly ignorant about framing his shots and lighting them as Kubrick was about scriptwriting.  For both of these guys their strong points are both their key to greatness and their crutch.  The effect is that when these strengths work it's good film and when it doesn't it's junk, no matter the budget.

reviews.review_title: The First of the Smith Dynasty
reviews.content: Okay, on first seeing this movie I thought it would be another first-time director cheap comedy film. I came out of the theater cracking up. The clever lines and random conversations Dante and Randall have through out the film are hilarious, and the weird customers coming in and out of the store were classic, I was always waiting to see what one of them would do or say. What even made the lines funnier were that the characters dropped the f bomb every sentence. But what really made this movie something is that it was all Kevin Smith. Kevin Smith wrote, directed, and even starred in the film... all being his first time! Directing is NOT easy folks, Smith makes it look easy with this film... and the fact that he could make about 5 more sequels based on this film are amazing. If your down in the dumps and looking for a movie that makes you laugh... I highly recommend this film.

Clerks a film made by Kevin Smith with a budget of about 27,000 dollars is an outstanding comedy. It is a hilarious from the start. It shows the truth about being in the workplace and having to serve people. It holds nothing back. The characters are great, there is Dante Hicks the Quickstop employee who's girlfriend has sucked off 37 guys and he is still in love with his high school sweet heart, Randal the porno watching video clerk and of course Jay and Silent Bob the local dealers. Along with a crazy cast of characters this movie is great, it should teach people to have more respect for store clerks or anyone who has a job in which they have to serve people. All in all this is an outstanding movie

reviews.review_title: Kevin Smith's first flick is a comedy masterstroke
reviews.content: The first film in director Kevin Smith's fabled "New Jersey Trilogy", "Clerks" is not only a fantastic comedy, but proof of what an ambitious filmmaker can do with a measley budget and a few buddies. For those rabid Jay and Silent Bob fans, rest assured this movie features very cool performances from the duo, including an out-of-nowhere dance sequence with Silent Bob and Jay's "Eat My C---" prank (hillarious!). Dante and Randall also deliver with awesome lines, notably the Star Wars discussion (always good in Kevin Smith's films). All in all, one couldn't ask for a better debut; "Clerks" is imaginative, funny, and most of all, impressive...especially considering that such entertainment was pulled off with such a low budget. Highly recommended! Score: A

I love this film because it's not your typical movie at all. The fact that Kevin Smith was able to make it with such a low budget gives other filmmakers hope. It's funny, doesn't take itself too seriously and there is an artistic vision that is less obvious than what I think most people give credit to.I think anyone in film school must watch this film and I would encourage low budget filmmakers to make something that isn't cut from the same cloth from your everyday films that get regurgitated over and over again. I love that this has a unique voice, that it is a product from the 90's which in my opinion was the best era of low budget films and I wish other filmmakers today too note. Back then when someone said independent films they meant low budget but now Hollywood has taken that and poured millions into a movie that just isn't the same and yet they call it "independent" film. Now we have to ask is it low budget or...? Point I'm truing to make is there is a bug difference between the indie films of the 90's and the indie (not indie really) films of today. To me I like watching someone do something special with little money and Clerks is not only fun to watch it's impressive too. Kevin Smith is also a really cool guy from what I've seen and he doesn't take himself too seriously and that's a good thing.I recommend this film! Have fun.

A black-and-white embodiment of imperfect perfection, where every joke lands and every line of dialogue is engaging. Arguably Kevin Smith's best film and given his filmography in the years that followed this cult classic, that is a compliment not to be taken lightly. Every bit as inspiring as it is funny, earnest, vulgar and relatable.

A lot of people mark this up as their favourite Kevin Smith flick, and whilst it is real close, it doesn't quite do it for me in the same way Mallrats did.  Maybe it was because Mallrats was the first Kevin Smith film I saw, or maybe not, whatever the reason, it still doesn't stop this film being a masterpiece of cult movies.Focusing on a day in the life of Dante, a convenience store clerk, and his relationship with the customers, his friend Randal, his girlfriend and his ex-girlfriend.  Encompassing many weird situations, Dante works through the crappy day he is having the best he can.Sure, at times the acting can be downright terrible, and occasionally the actors speak so fast its difficult to comprehend what they are saying, and sometimes the camera work does get annoying, but put these small greivances aside and you are left with rioutious laugh-fest which is at times still thought-provoking.  A must-see film.  9/10

Kevin Smith, known to the civilized as well as uncivilized world as Silent Bob, proves that it doesn't take money, knowing the right people, or color in order to create a film gem.  It does take extreme talent, devotion, and risk in order to create, virtually out of nothing, A TRUE MASTERPIECE.This film is centered around a day in the lives of two clerks; one working in a small time convenience mart and the other hardly working at a small time video rental store.  The video store and the convenience mart are connected together just like all the characters are connected through their ultra realistic events that bring their lives into contact.  The antics, personalities, hang-ups, and life views of the characters touch on the life making decisions forced on almost all young adults in a very intriguing and entertaining way.  What more can be said about the extreme talent and comical insight of Director/Actor/Producer Kevin Smith.Jason Mewes, Jay, is Silent Bob's sidekick.  Together they form one of the greatest comedic teams ever to hit the big screen.  Kevin Smith has single handedly made successful acting careers for some of the characters in this film that would have probably never considered acting in the first place. As I am told, the only actor in this film with any training or even a small amount of acting experience is the convenience store clerk, Dante. Everyone else in the film, thanks to Kevin Smith, bring out the very best in themselves in order to make this film spectacular.If you haven't seen this film, stop cheating yourself.  You as well as all people are too wonderful to miss out on the best directed, intellectually thought out, and probably best 90 minutes you will ever spend.  The Clerks, 10 out of 10, my favorite film of all time.

These comments may sound like i don't like his work...I really do, i've seen all his movies and enjoyed most of them (not Mallrats). There's much more than meets the eye in 'Clerks,' on the surface this film looks as if it's another teen movie romp. That's just where it begins.Clerks is a movie about two slackers (Dante & Randal.) Dante works at an ill-maintains convenience (the kind you dread to enter on a road trip to avoid kooky clerks and a grungy bathroom) but instead the clerk is a slacker (Dante) and the bathroom has no lights after 5:00 P.M. (you'll understand.) Dante is a college dropout he's caught up in an unhealthy relationship with his girlfriend (Veronica) mostly because she's ambitious and he's well a college dropout. Randal is Dante's counter-part and works at a lousy video-store next to Dante's place-of-business. Randal is worst off career-wise on account of he's not even a college drop-out. Reason I only mentioned career-wise is Randal isn't caught up in an unhealthy cycle with a significant-other and isn't physcologically self-destructive.The movie isn't a satire of work but a parody of 'The Divine Comedy,' which is a poem that is credited as one of the first depictions of hell. The reason it's a parody and not a satire is that it shows that not work can be hell but life can be if you make it hard on yourself. Dante makes live a living hell with the words 'I'm not even supposed to be here today!' While Randal makes the best of life and work by renting hermaphrodite porn, or living on his own terms. Another reason it's a satire on Divine Comedy is the main characters have the same name and the story is split into nine chapters. Smith try's to make it clear with Dante's realization that he needs to live life do the fullest with the speech by Jay and Bob. Another hint is much more subtle like the song at the credits with the chorus is 'I may never get what I wanted' artist unknown to my knowledge but is another clear identifier to the film.

reviews.review_title: A great movie. Kevin Smith is a genius. I can't wait to see what he does next.
reviews.content: Kevin Smith did a great job in his first movie with what he had to work with.  His movies have kept getting better and I can't wait for Dogma to come out.

Every so often a writer or director can tell a story that truly connects with the audience, making it seem as if the characters that appear on the screen are people we actually know. Kevin Smith is a truly gifted writer, and Clerks (his debut film) really proves this.Dante, a 22 year old convenience store clerk, is forced to come to work on a day that he was promised he could take off. A miserable Dante shows up to work and his day progressively becomes worse. The film is basically what happens during the crazy day with Dante, and his best friend Randall who runs the video store next door. I'm not going to go to much further into the plot because I don't want to ruin anything for future viewers.The story is at times hilarious, and at times serious with out being over the top. Smith is brilliant at making a movie with a lot of heart without going over the top or making it seem unreal. The dialog is sharp, witty, and always fun. For a breakout film that cost $27,000 to put together, everyone involved with the movie gives the viewer a feel that their veterans rather than rookies. All the performances are realistic and wonderful, but Jeff Anderson steals the show as Randall, the sarcastic and witty but loyal best friend.Clerks is a must see film that truly inspired many other films/shows or at least paved the road for them, such as Office Space, The Office,etc. Don't miss this masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: Kevin Smith is the funniest man alive
reviews.content: Clerks is one of the best movies of all time.  Kevin Smith's script is witty and intelligent and has some of the funniest characters ever.  The dialogue never lulls from "Berserker" to Randall wanting to expand his horizons. Rent this movie today!

As a film in the world of high budget masterpieces, thought provoking, super celebrity casts, mindblowing FX's , and debate-level dialogue, this movie fails. But...as a low budget film that satisfies, no, expands the cinematic mind, Kevin Smith did a wonderful job. This film takes humor and wit, and sloshes it around a bit with crude humanity to show the world as some of the "unique" people among us see things. And if you look long enough, and hard enough, you'll see we're all a little unique deep inside...

reviews.review_title: This movie could change your life, it has mine.....
reviews.content: You hate your job; you have an ex-girlfriend, who although was a horrible girlfriend, for some reason you can't get over her; your friends are all you have sometimes, even though they annoy the crap out of you; and you generally loath everything around you.  This is the basic synopsis of the life of Dante.  The main character of Clerks. I heard many things about this movie, but never got around to rent it until the Summer of 1999.  Renting it was one of the greatest things I could have done.  Certain scenes in the movie are side splitting, while others you can't help but laugh at because you know it has happened to you.  But beyond the humor of the movie is a very important message.  Convenience isn't always the best thing.  Dante has a job and a girlfriend, but it seems as if he isn't going anywhere.  While his life may be very convenient for him, he knows it isn't the best thing, and that there is more.  This small piece of advice greatly affected a situation in my life, and helped me make a decision that I couldn't decide upon.  While it is unlikely Clerks will have the same impact upon your life, it should definitely be a film you should see at all costs.

Clerks is the story of how two clerks (one in a convenience store and the other in a video rental) spend a day. What a day it was. Dante is the clerk in the convenience store and is called on his day off to manage it, his boss tells him he'll be back by noon and till then he should look after the store. He has a hockey game at 2 PM which he's looking forward to .Randall is the guy next door who is "managing" the video rental store. reviews.review_title: My favorite film of all time is a perfect comedy.
reviews.content: The perfect film for pseudo art house intellectuals, Kevin Smith's hilarious $27,000-debut feature "Clerks" is simply a perfect comedy. Smith's script combines vulgar, gross-out topics with rants on some things as basic as love and relationships. The two are so seamlessly sewn together, they make the works of one of Smith's biggest influences, John Hughes, seem tame in comparison. The hilarity never slows in the 90-minute masterpiece as Smith manages to involve some plot in what's basically a chat comedy. The film is surprisingly well-acted considering all of the cast's amateur status, with Jeff Anderson as the lead character's sidekick Randal turning in one of the most memorable comedic performances ever. Three films ("Mallrats", "Chasing Amy", and "Dogma") later this remains Smith's most enjoyable work. It's legacy has been firmly stamped as one of the most important and influential independent films of all time and it has landed Smith an army of loyal followers.

reviews.review_title: an interesting gem in Smith's New Jersey saga
reviews.content: Wonderfully tasteful and delightfully funny, this piece of comic genius could only have been thought up by Kevin Smith the Mallrat man. Kevin Smith is a genius filmmaker. He proves this with his funny, dialogue filled story of two employees (of a video store and a convenience store) and the day that they have. The movie is absolutely hilarious, with Brian O'Halloran as the whiny Dante and Jeff Anderson as the cocky, smart-ass Randal Graves. Smith also makes an appearance, with his friend Jason Mewes, who plays drug-dealer Jay. The film could have used some color, but the black and white gave it the independent feel and worked well. Bottom line: one of the funniest films I've ever seen, but also one of the best films ever. A thought provoking intelligent comedy like this one does not come along often. See it or you'll miss out.

I'd never seen this movie, but I knew of it and that I was pretty good.  PRETTY GOOD??? This movie rocked and rocked my world! I realized that I needed to step back from life and take a breather. Thanks to this movie, I figured out my life.  I know this seems far fetched, but it's all true.  I now continue both my job as a "clerk" and my schooling in Business Management.  Ironic, Isn't it? SEE THIS MOVIE!!!

"Clerks" was the breakout film that transformed director/writer Kevin Smith's status as a virtual unknown to a powerhouse director seemingly overnight. The film started as an independent project starring unknown actors shot on a meager budget, but ended up being one of the most revered cult classic films of the 1990's. The film starred Brian O'Halloran as Dante Hicks and Jeff Anderson as Dante's best friend Randal Graves. Throughout the film Dante and Randal deal with all sorts of issues common to the Generation X audience this film was intended for. Focusing on the stereotypical slacker image, Smith takes viewers on a one day trip in the lives of store clerks Dante and Randal and the comical, but yet serious, series of events and revelations they encounter that day. Nothing is spared in this film as everything from love, sex, death, friendship, and uncertainty about the future are all touched upon at one time or another. Overall, the whole underlying theme of the film seems to be about how sometimes when you can't find a direction in life, a direction will find you and you should run with it. Clerks also introduced audiences to two other important characters, Jay and Silent Bob. Jay (played by Jason Mewes) and Silent Bob (played by Kevin Smith) play the drug peddling slackers that spend the entire day hanging out in front of the convenience store antagonizing Dante and Randal. While these characters provide brief scenes of comedic relief to the film, Clerks provided the groundwork for their own full feature film, Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, which is a cult classic in its own right. This also proved to be a theme that Smith followed in his future films as cameo appearances of Jay and Silent Bob appeared in many of his future films such as Chasing Amy, Dogma, and Clerks 2. When watching Clerks, perhaps the most immediate thing a viewer will notice is that the film was shot in rough stock black and white as opposed to the more common high definition color used in most modern films. This smart decision by Smith gives the film almost a documentary style feel to it and adds a sense of reality, which makes the comedic performances in the film even more believable and humorous. It was a refreshing change of pace from the highly polished and scripted comedies often seen at that time and adds to the indie charm of the film. It is hard to believe that this film was released nearly 20 years ago and even harder to believe that a small budget indie film such as Clerks would be so relevant then and continues to be today. This film is truly a classic in every sense of the word, and I am glad that it was recognized as such when it was released. The themes present in this film really encapsulated the feelings of the Gen X'ers at the time, but the Gen Y and newer audience will not feel short changed watching this film, as the comedy and issues are timeless.

reviews.review_title: Clerks is brilliant, but Kevin Smith knew it

It was however, and incredibly good film.

reviews.review_title: Cult Classic Showing the Mastery of Director/Writer Kevin Smith
reviews.content: First off let me tell you that Clerks is like no other movie of its time. This is definitely a cult classic that should be viewed by all to see the mastery of director/writer Kevin Smith. This is a film that was made during the hours that the Quick Mart convenience store was closed. At the time of filming Kevin Smith was actually a worker at this Quick Mart and would work during the day and film at night with little or no sleep.The story is based around the character Dante Hicks played by Brian O'Halloran and the theme is the day and life of a store clerk. Dante is called into work on a day he was suppose to be off. Throughout the day he deals with numerous problems including dealing with incompetent customers, trying to go to his hockey game, finding out that one of his ex-girlfriends have died as well as another ex-girlfriend trying to hook back up with him, all the while trying to stay with his current girlfriend. The only other characters that play a huge role in this film are Jay played by Jason Mewes and Silent Bob played by Kevin Smith. The two characters of Jay and Silent Bob hang out outside the Quick Mart and just do their own thing throughout the movie. If the scene was not revolving around Dante and Jeff it would be revolving around Jay and Silent Bob. Silent Bob only speaks once in this film and it is to give advice to Dante towards the end of the movie.This movie was shot in black and white and I believe this is what makes this film such a cult classic. Filming it this way really brought you into the mundane lives of Dante and Randal played by Jeff Anderson and what it was like to be a store clerk; Dante at Quick Mart and Randal at the video store. An idea that repeats itself through the movie is when new scenes are introduced the director cuts to new scenes by going to an all black screen with a word in white lettering. These words are used to let us the viewers know what is going to be portrayed in the next scene. You will see this done numerous times throughout the film.The only movie that I can even compare this to is Clerks II where both Dante and Randal have left their clerk jobs at the Quick Mart and video store and are now employees of a fast food chain. Both movies are about the same with Clerks II being a carbon copy of the first but in color and with new jobs.If you can get by all the cussing and all the crude humor of this film which I was able to do this film is ridiculously funny with interesting characters, the occasional unusual jokes, and witty references. A must see for all especially store clerks since they can relate to the theme of a day and life of a store clerk.

With its low budget, and new crew, lots of people thought that Clerks would be a flop....they were TOTALLY wrong. Clerks just started a whole series of hilariously funny movies that Kevin Smith wrote and directed. Jay and Silent Bob epics too! The humor of the movie is so amazing it makes up for every problem such as the black an white colors (or lack there of). The events that happen become the inside jokes for more movies to come from the Independent film director. My stomach still burns from all the laughter!

reviews.review_title: Kevin Smith + Black and White = One of the best black and white comedy films ever!
reviews.content: Kevin Smith's first film that became a cult hit and is my favorite Kevin movie of all time. You know Clerks as people that check out food for you. Let me ask you do you know there real life? In this kick ass movies follow Dante and Randal through a bizzare day. They play hockey on the store roof, Visit a funeral, and more. Go buy it on DVD or rent it.

reviews.review_title: Watching people talk was never this good
reviews.content: This movie entirely changed my views on watching movies.One would get already bored knowing the movie is totally black and white,has no big star,deals with only two people talking at a convenience store.For the first 10 minutes I too wondered how am I going to watch this one and was confused why would the people rate the movie so high.But then,I was just left with a whopping surprise.The flick proves that only the best screenplay can lead to an awesome movie and nothing else.Jeff Anderson has a superb voice and a great skill which just makes one feel that he ain't acting.Jay and silent Bob,what can I say,people might have tried being junkies leaving everything just to know how one feel being Jay and silent Bob.I felt the animated part was unnecessary,felt it was breaking the link of the movie.The director has made me his fan for a life-time,guaranteed.Kudos to you Kevin Smith!

reviews.review_title: The current record for best movie w/ lowest budget.
reviews.content: WARNING: Plot spoiling information may be included!Ladies, Ladies, Ladies, Logan & S.C. are in the house! Puhzaa!!!A day in the life of two nowhere-bound convenience and video store clerks (Dante and Randal), and the two eccentric drug dealers (Jay and Silent Bob) who constantly hang out outside the stores.Logan: This movie is absoulutely as realistic as it gets (except for the dead guy-bathroom thing). All of these things could happen in one day, and the fact that its made with $30,000 and still manages to be excellent is amazing. The only real problem is a lack of plot. This is the first of the View Askew "Jersey Trilogy", and that means Jay and Silent Bob. 9/10S.C.: This is not a low budget movie, its a no budget movie with no plot. The only plot in this move is "I'm not even supposed to be here today".and the moral of the story is dont go to work if you are called in on your day off. 8.7/10
One of the best film ever made in history. i worked as a clerk many years and i've met all these kinds of people.. i did some randall's quotes and stuff lol

reviews.review_title: A very intelligent and funny film. Definetly one of the top 250
reviews.content: I really liked this movie. It was the first View Askew movie but, I saw the last one (Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back) first so this movie only made more since when I saw it. I think this movie was a savior for comedic films in that it really suggests that funny films can not only make sense, but also not be degrading to your IQ.Although this movie was #210 in the top 250 films ever made, there were some flaws. Miramax should've had more trust in View Askew and given it more than 30,000 dollars. That's why the whole film had no color, no special effects (aside from the chapter listing announcing new scenes) and took place mainly in the Quick Stop. Kevin Smith is more a writer with a camera than a director. Some say that the actors in his movies are never that believable but this film was different (even though it was his first one). I really thought that Brian Christopher and Jeff Anderson did a great job 'running the Quick Stop'. This film was a great one, see it, if you know what 'Lamentation' means.

reviews.review_title: Perhapes the difinitive Gen X film.
reviews.content: Clerks is the story of the day in the life of a person we really don't think about often ecept when in a convience store, A clerk. Our own preconceptions of clerks and the people who are Clearks is what make this film so funny, and so good at reflecting the time it has presented.Dante,Randel,Vironica,Kaytlen, and the always unforgetable losers Jay and Silent Bob. We write these people off because they have an easy job and therfore have little or no intelegence. That's contrary to the witty dialoge that comes out of the mouths of these discarded youth. You might sy that thats not true because the writer was just some genieus that wanted us to respect employed persones. No Kevin Smith, like Quinten Tarentino, worked as a clerk; So it's easy then to conclude that these people didn't work there because thats all they could do , but because they flet comfertalbe doing so;Not wanting change. I can tell you it was filmed in 16mm, black and white, and cost about 25,000. This is a suppreme story of true film making, by any means nessesary. Is the world an ememy to them, or are they ememies to them selves. That quetion is never really ansewer, and dosn't need to be. You can only hope in what ever univerce they exisiste they found happiness. Watch to laugh. Never try to annticipate anything. Being on Smiths ride is what make this film lasting and timeless, in at least a way.

Clerks is the chronicle of a day in the life of Dante Hicks, an oppressed quick-stop attendant whose romantic attitude is reflected in his characters name. He and Randal, a disrespectful video shop worker, have battles of wit that are interspersed with the modern take on slapstick that is Jay and Silent Bob. Kevin Smith's debut is black and white in both colour and tone, and markedly full of clear contrasts between 'high' and 'low' comedy, and between the characters that inhabit these easily seperable strands of plot. There is little, or close to nothing actually wrong with the film, except sometimes it feels as if the loose central plot has been blissfully abandoned in an attempt to heighten the comedy. This, in most films would be a severe failing, but the humour is of such a high standard in the hands of Smith's scriptwriting that it feels more like a pleasure than a pain.

reviews.review_title: bunch of savages in this town
reviews.content: this movie takes place on a very unusual Saturday for Dante Hicks the resident clerk at the Quick stop on his off day no less SPOILERS he has to deal with his longing for his ex-girlfriend his current girl friends sexual history his own opinion of " backward ass f****" he calls customers and to top it off he has a hockey game at two MORE SPOILERS but thanks to his best friend Randal and a couple of legendary drug dealers Jay and Silent Bob it makes for gritty realistic ultra-cheap comedy from the brilliant mind of Kevin Smith I personally love this movie and is in constant rotation in my five movie DVD list (guess what the other four movies are) so if you personally enjoy great one liners black and white movie goodness and legendary comedic duos this is the flick for you

For many years I worked the retail positions and when I first saw this movie it was the closest depiction of real life I had ever seen. This film is a cult classic for a reason, people can connect with it. The indie film maker Kevin Smith began his journey with this piece of art that even blew his expectations away. I recommend this film to anyone who works retail and understands what it's like to be bored for a living. The back and forth banter between 2 employees of a convenience store is spot on and the lovable stoner's jay and silent bob are a beautiful depiction of what pot smokers are really like. This film was the origin of the well known heterosexual soul mates jay and silent bob, these two have become the icons of weed and every stoner can quote at least one line from a Kevin Smith film. If you want to see pure 90s independent cinema than this is the film to watch. If you find that you can't relate to this film than you probably have better things you could be doing other than watching movies.

reviews.review_title: Changed my life and the way I view movies
reviews.content: I saw this movie as a young impressionable 17 year old and it changed me. Sure, it is crude, poorly acted and the screen writing/directing is fair at best. However, the conversations between the characters was one of the first times that I realized that movies, especially dialogue did not need to be "theatrical" and overblown. It could be a reflection of conversations I might have with my friends, and it could enthrall! Today this movie may not seem that unique, and that is due in part to the influence that Kevin Smith has had on the industry, but it will always hold a special place in my heart.The story is simple, a day in the life of 2 slackers. Dante works at the convenience store and his friend Randal works next door at the video store (ask your parents what this was kids). Throughout the day the deal with drug dealers, dead people, strange customers, girlfriends, etc, etc.Do yourself a favor and look for the DVD that includes the alternate ending. It is quite a shock and change in tone from the movie and original ending. I still go back and forth as to which one I like better.

reviews.review_title: I am not even supposed to be here today!
reviews.content: I actually give this a 9.5/10 but as it's not allowed to do this ratings i'm giving it a 10. First time I watched the movie I was very impressed about it, I just expected a few laughs and I thought I would forget about it since I'm not a big fan of "cult movies" but it's awfully good, great script, great performance by leading and supporting actors and great direction from Kevin Smith regardless his limitations (made out of a minimal budget and with friends as casting). I always watch the movies I like twice to see if I still like as much as the first time and this was no exception; I think I could watch it 5 times in a row and wouldn't get bored, so go watch it and pray for Clerks III to be released soon.

What a fantastic film. Having seen all of Kevin Smith's post Clerks productions, I was relentlessly pestered by my friends to watch this classic and having finally got hold of it, I must say it was a pleasant but not unusual surprise. I didn't really know what to expect other than it is in black and white and scripted by our beloved producer but what a hilarious film it turned out to be.The dialogue is typical Kevin Smith work, evident in his later films such as dogma and chasing amy, and might I add work that I thoroughly enjoy. The film was shot on a budget so don't expect anything fancy. No real big names although by now you should have heard of some of the actors.It will appear that this film is more appealing to Kevin Smith fans and not really for the faint hearted movie viewers who prefer clichés and typical dialogue (including them awful one liners). Oh no no no, this is one fast talking, twisted and very entertaining movie, but one that can only be appreciated when one can lower his/her inhibitions.Give it a shot, it's something different and if it's your cup of tea then you should love this movie, but if not then come back to it at a later date, you may actually appreciate this film at some point in your life!

From the opening moments until the closing credits, this film had me laughing. I know people just like every character in this movie and I could relate to everyone. I think that Kevin Smith and Jason Mewes are incredibly funny and insightful. If you have not seen it, it is a must see. I have been a clerk and can say that what the clerk in this film goes through while maybe somewhat exaggerated, is what many if not most clerks deal with on a day to day basis. Unless you have lived under a rock your whole life, you can probably name a friend who is just like those in this flick. I have a special place in my heart for these comedic geniuses.

clerks is truly a breath of fresh air against the Hollywood blockbuster of it's time, a truly original film from then-newcomer Kevin Smith Worth watching purely for the characters and the interesting and funny conversations (watch out if easily offended as much of the subject matter is not for the young or weak of mind) The low budget of the production only adds to the appeal of this movie. The use of black and white completes the mood and style of this picture, which is worth watching over and over. Kevin smith's follow up movies are extremely watchable and fun, but Clerks will always hold a special place in the archives of movie history for me.

reviews.review_title: a film shot in a corner shop.... why not
reviews.content: lets make it simple, no special effects, no staring cast, no advertising and no corporate influence - just two guys working in a low class job trying to find ways to break down their day. so your probably thinking why should i watch this film, its in black and white there is no major story line, the world is not in danger, there's no plot or a goal to be reached so why watch it? Very simply its incredibly funny - about two guys working in dead end jobs when they should be in collage. I don't know about you, but i have been in that situation, the characters relate to the most basic of people, and being a normal under appreciated worker i know what its like to be in that situation. for a person who hasn't seen it ill give some advice, don't do what i did and turn it off after five mins, wait until you here the number 37 - by this point you'll be so involved with the film that you wont care about the fact its in black in white, or that it was made with a budget under 30k. P.S. its good that films can be made without special effects and be a hit in todays modern age

This movie had the potential to be absolutly perfect, and judging by the story outline, I'd say it needed a little vulgarity in it. That's what made it fun, right? I'd say so, but some of the stuff they talk about in this film goes a bit through the roof. It gets to the point where you say "That's not funny, that's absolutely repulsive!" Maybe you'll agree.

reviews.review_title: Pure inspiration -- Kevin Smith is God
reviews.content: This movie is intelligent and funny, a combination hard to find in this day and age of "let's throw in a school bus of nuns blowing up as the Washington Monument falls on them!"  It's refreshing to see a movie not only this good, but also made on a budget of $26,500. Kevin Smith inspired me to become a director myself.  And here I sit now, a communications major that is writing his first screenplay in the other window.  This is, in my opinion, the best movie ever made, hands down.  If you haven't seen it, GET IT NOW!!!!

This is probably my favorite movie that I've ever seen.  Why, cause let's look at it.  Practically no scenery, no big-name movie stars, almost no budget, yet Kevin Smith makes a movie that is probably one of the most original movies ever.  Also, Jay & Silent Bob rule!

The best thing about this movie is it is real, nothing like these shows where everyone is perfect or the plot is unrealistic.  It portrays real people in real life situations and it has strong characters, you know a little about their lives.  There's humor and more in this movie and it is definitely in my top 100 :o)

I absolutely LOVE this movie, one of the best ever created.  I remember the first time I watched it, never laughed so hard in my life.  Its honest, every day life that people can associate with! I love this movie with all my heart.....much love to the actors for their wonderful job!

Just Awesome.  Kevin Smith is an inspiration.  Kevin is one of the few talents that can make poetry out of profanity.  Dante and Randal are unforgettable.  If you liked them in the movie, you should read the comic book.  Kevin Smith can do no wrong.  Even Mallrats was a pleasure to watch, despite the initial bashing of mass audiences.  So keep up the good work Kev!!

This was perhaps the funniest film I've ever seen.  This film documents the life of a convenient store clerk in suburban New Jersey.  The incredibly low budget, and the never before seen actors added to this.  Profanity was turned into poetry.

"Clerks" is Kevin Smith's first ground-breaking feature portraying his intricate mold of smooth-talking "big words" in conversations you were always too afraid to discuss. The true film unfolds not within a strong involved plot of any sort but amovie showing the kinds of conversations we all wish we could have but haven't. The film is controversial and obscene at times, but you have to love the way Smith pulls everything off tastefully and makes you question the things we only think about, but never say aloud.

THIS MOVIE KICKS!!!! IF YOU LIKE PROFANE, OFF COLOR (OFTEN VULGAR AND DISTASTEFUL) HUMOR, AND IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN IT, RENT IT NOW!!! ALSO WATCH "MALLRATS" , "CHASING AMY" , AND "DOGMA", ALL WRITTEN BY CRITICALLY ACCLAIMED DIRECTOR/COMIC BOOK WRITER KEVIN SMITH. YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!!!

reviews.review_title: A very good movie for such low budget
reviews.content: This is probably the best low-budget movie I have ever seen. The acting is great and the soundtrack is awesome! "Chewie, is that you...?"

reviews.review_title: Clerks shows that small budget doesn't mean a bad movie
reviews.content: In Clerks, Kevin Smith shows a slice-of life, much like Heinrick Ibsen or whomever else you want to refer back to. However, unlike the playwrights of the past, Smith does a good job. His writing skills are superb. Others have said that the acting in this movie was not very good, but I disagree. It's as realistic as most of the time I spend around others, although I'll admit that's not saying much. Anyway, many people, including both my parents, found the language offensive. I say to them, I find you offensive. Not liking a movie for it's language is silly. Pay attention to what the movie says, not how it says it. Clerks was a great movie. **********

reviews.review_title: It's bizarre. It's disgusting at times. It's one of the (if not THE) funniest movies I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I heard about Clerks, a full four years after it came out, through my friends. We were hanging around the Blockbuster Video we frequent, and I happened upon "Clerks." My friends recommended it, I being the only one who hadn't seen it, let alone heard of it. So, I gave the cashier my five bucks and took the movie home for a viewing.I wasn't disappointed, not in the least. In the past, the most hilarious movies I'd seen had had their lulls, periods (usually mercifully brief) in which the jokes aren't as funny, such as the movie "North," one of the few examples when the entire effin' movie was an unfunny piece of trash. "Clerks" had no lulls. Almost all of the jokes, from Randall's self-pleasuring cousin to the horny corpse in the bathroom inspired some form of a laugh in me, from a chuckle to an outright belly laugh.The movie has some disgusting, yet amazingly funny sequences. Only Kevin Smith could make this movie the masterpiece it is, writing a day in the life of Dante Hicks gone horribly, horribly wrong, from the gum in the lock, to the fact that his girlfriend has orally serviced thirtysomething men, to the climactic fight between the two stars. It's extreme, it's vulgar, it's crude, it's got my guarantee... you'll love it, or you'll hate it. I hope you love it as much as I do.All in All: "Clerks" is unique among all the movies I've seen. It's like an 80's sex comedy, with no sex, but a surplus of comedy.

I rented this movie one night because there wasn't anything else in that night.My lovely girlfriend at the time,Shara,and I had heard it won some award.We decided to get it and watch it.Well that night we watched it twice and once again the next morning.It is my all time favorite movie.I have my VCR wired to my stereo and Put the audio on a cassette tape so we could listen to it on the way to Florida one year.The whole two weeks of vacation we would quote the movie to each other.Now when ever we see each other we still do it.Do yourself a favor and see this movie. got to go .NO TIME FOR LOVE ,DOCTOR JONES!  I'll always love you meowser !!

A hilarious movie. I know that half the people who want to rent this movie are discouraged by the independent thing. u cant even notice it theres no cheezey special effects or something its just a flat out one location story. the jokes range from both hi brow to low brow. the references also range from obscure to pop culture. i mean how often can u find a line in a movie such asDante:37, my girlfriend sucked 37 d**ks!!Costumer: In a row???!!rating : nine stars(out of ten)

I just about caught this movie as it started on TV, and I had been in a rut for a few days.  This film not only lifted me from that with perfect comedy but it also changed my aspect on daily life, I couldn't believe how funny dialogue between two people could be and the star wars scene is pure class, finally a film which made me laugh from start to finish

Kevin's Smith's genius continues to amaze me.  Made with a budget twice lower than blair witch's budget, he uses excellent dialogues with smart, funny comedy, reminiscent of a more quirky woody allen. If you want to laugh from start to finish, go to the local video store and rent Clerks, or any other Kevin Smith movie for that matter...You wont be dissappointed.

I was a clerk when Clerks was released in theaters.  I had heard there was a movie coming out about a guy working in a convenience store, and I thought, "I've got to see this movie!" So I did, and I could not believe how great the movie was.  I related to everything in it, from the annoying customers, to Dante's ambivalence about what to do with his life, to coming in on your day off to work. Yes, the acting is a little shaky.  That is the only negative I have about the movie.  The dialogue is great.  I am always throwing out quotes from Clerks.  I highly recommend getting the DVD to listen to the director's comments.  It's hysterical.

Just seen that movie and all I can say is WOW!!! Being the kind of guy who hates comedies because they always disappoint me, this movie stands as a much appreciated exception. It has a huge amount of extremely funny situations, clever dialog and a nice inside look on the 'clerk' perspective...By the way, I've as well seen 2 more Kevin Smith's works - Dogma and Mallrats and as a "guy who hates comedies" I want to warn you - AVOID them at all cost! Watch Clerks instead and you'll spend a WONDERFUL hour and a half, believe me!

Witty, smart, cool, unique and very rude - that's Clerks.  The idea of a movie about a day in the life of a convenience store clerk is hardly inspiring, but Kevin Smith manages to make it appealing and absorbing.  The lack of much real action can be ignored by concentrating on the sharp dialogue, what really drives this film along.  I am a huge fan of Kevin Smith and love Mallrats, Chasing Amy and Dogma, but if you have never seen any of his movies, Clerks is definitely the one to see first.  Clerks is Kevin Smith at his best. And I want to know how, despite having relatively small parts, Jay and Silent Bob manage to steal every one of the scenes they are in, in every one of his movies?!

Another brilliant comedy from writer/director Kevin Smith.  I personally own this movie and I urge anyone who likes a good, well-written comedy with a wonderful cast of characters.  If you liked Mallrats, or Chasing Amy, chances are you'll love Clerks.

reviews.review_title: can he ever follow this one up?
reviews.content: I first saw this film a little while ago round my friends house I had only just heard the name Kevin Smith (Dogma was just being released in the U.K). And I have to say this film has life changing effects. Is it any wonder that Mallrats failed how could he ever follow this one up?.

Okay, how can you not like this movie?  Seriously.  If you've ever worked a day of your miserable life in customer service, as I'm sure many of you have, then this is the film for you.  And if you refuse to watch it because its in B&W, then you are a fool, and you have my pity.  In closing, I laughed, until I stopped.
I feel very good and very useful in my sad days. Thank you very much.

reviews.review_title: Simply the best comedy of all time...
reviews.content: I watched this movie, having never heard of it or what it was about and ended up completely surprised and in stitches as it is simply the best comedy of all time. It's a low budget film that uses actors over and over, and even due to low funds, required the crew and their family members to play bit parts. However, budget was a not a problem in creating a perfectly scripted and directed comedy.It's about Dante Hicks who works in a convenience store and the banality of life - the contrary customers, the annoyance when window shutters won't open; the long lost girlfriend who is about to be married; the current girlfriend with a past he'd rather forget; the stoners that hang out outside; a funeral which was more eventful than it should have been and the poor customer who took too long in the bathroom....The script is absolutely fabulous - unparalleled by any other comedy - and the direction is to perfection. I really cannot praise this movie enough. Rent it as soon as you can. Some may find it vulgar but it really is a wonderful pastiche on dead-end jobs. Please - rent it. You will not be disappointed!

Clerks does it for me every time.  It is a cheap and nasty looking film but the way that Kevin Smith turns that into such a great film is unbelievable. I have never come across a movie that has the same humour as me, which is why I think it is fantastic.  I even use the lines on a regular basis in everyday life.  It will always be not only my favourite Kevin Smith flick but alltime favourite flick.  All of the characters make me laugh just thinking of them.I give Clerks 10/10.

I though that Clerks was refreshing in that it didn't have big name actors or budget but made a good film all the same. The acting wasn't so great but what should I expect? The sheer concept of the movie is something new. Just look how great it is even though not a single bad guy is blown away by machine gun fire. If only more films would make something new and not of existing formulae. I hope to see Jay and Silent Bob strike back, doubt it will be very good, but I have hopes all the same.

this movie is one of the greatest I've ever seen.  such a low budget movie and loved the black and white thing.  Kevin smith is a genius, doesn't matter what anyone says. this movie helps you realize things.  i could watch it over and over again.

clerks was a fantastic movie by kevin smith to get his writing and directorial carrer on its way and with this movie it opened many doors for him and he jumped on every chance he got and it has taken him many places and he has made a total of 5 excellent movies surrounding the basic group of characters from NJ especially Jay and Silent Bob and it will be sad to see them leave but if u go see them this weekend and help bring Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back to #1 in the box offices Kevin Smith will still have 1 more thing to do with them!!!!!!So go and see that movie!!!!!

Without doubt, the film that made me want to make films. I'd heard about this when it was first released, but was unable to find it on release anywhere. I finally caught up with it on video about a year later, boy was it worth the wait.I hadn't, and still haven't, seen dialogue like it. The fact that Kevin Smith had the balls to make this film off a credit card should be incentive enough to all of us. We can do it. I think to be fair, he touched a nerve. Not only with myself, but apparently with a high percentage of people in my age bracket, it's a true to life, yet wetpants funny, sample of late teen life.The acting ain't great, the lighting ain't great, but who cares - the film is excellent, and thankfully kick started the career of one of the most under-rated film maestros around.

THE FILM:If you have been following the indie film information at all, you would know this is a very cult hit. It follows a day in the life of Dante Hicks, an over-educated clerk. He meets up with his friend Randal, finds out some sexual information about his girlfriend and more. At the heart of the film is actually quite an important message about life. When you see the film you will understand what i mean. This film doesn't really have a plot. It is just the wild adventures of a guy, which ranges from playing hockey on the roof to knocking a casket over at a funeral. Jay & Silent Bob(Clerks, Mallrats, Chasing Amy, Dogma, Jay & Silent Bob Strike Back also make their first movie experience. The writing and direction by Kevin Smith is brilliant, due to low budget restrictions(It was made for 27 000) their is not to much action in the film, but Smith's dialogue is brilliant. You know that if the Hollywood HotShots remade this, they would only take a tiny little bit of dialogue and just put a bunch of slapstick in. Overall, the film is an enjoyable experience. THE DVD:This is one of the best. Any Clerks fan will want it for the infamous alternate ending, but the real thing here is the audio commentary(In which Jason Mewes is drunk). You will love this DVD.

reviews.review_title: here comes randall, he's a berserker
reviews.content: How does this only have an 8 average? This movie was genius. I think the $30,000 budget was made this so great. If they'd used color, or real actors, it would have felt...cheap (kind of ironic). Also, Randal is under used if films. SPIELBERG!! Jeff Anderson needs to be in more movies!!

Lets be honest, good comedies are hard to find these days, with Adam Sandler and Ben Stiller all hogging the lime light, but this is a comedy of gigantic proportions. Filmed on a $25.000 budget and filmed in black and white Clerks really should have been a really bad film, but how wrong you could be. Snappy script, excellent acting from no names and absolute brilliant jokes whats not to like, I'll tell you nothing this is brilliant. Even thought Keviin Smith has made six films since even a sequel to Clerks non will ever be as good as his original Indie masterpiece. My hat is off to you Kevin Smith!! This is how it should be done, NON OF THAT SANDLER CRAP!!

"Clerks" is pure inspiration at it's best, directed by my long-time favorite director/actor Kevin Smith. I thought that I had seen Smith's best in "Chasing Amy" and "Dogma", but was sorely mistaken after watching "Clerks".Dante, and Randal are two characters that I can sympathize with, and actually empathize with. Living in a small town creates conventionalism that surpasses boredom in every possible aspect. When things become conventional they must become lively and unpredictable; which seems to explain my small town life rather well. For 92 minutes I felt like I was glimpsing what my life is slowly becoming, someday being a Clerk in a small town store, wishing I were, perhaps, playing hockey on a rooftop.The unsubtle comedy had me in tears, especially due to the fact that it was for the majority unpredictable. I felt the genius of Kevin Smith's insight seeping through my pores when I got up after the movie. I've been dwelling on it every since; hoping to use the independent film style of Kevin Smith for my movie currently in the making (the script anyways). I don't think Smith could have delved into the lives of two slackers and all of the sudden hysteria that surrounds them any better than he did. In light of that I give this movie a 10, and hope to watch more brilliance jump at me from the screen in the future so that I may experience the same euphoria over, and over.

I vividly remember the first time I watched Clerks.  About a year and a half ago I was staying at a friend of mines house.  It was about twelve at night and I said I wanted to watch a movie.  He asked me if I had ever seen Clerks and I responded no.  He popped it into his VCR and turned on the stereo speakers.  The minute that Dante first appeared I was taken with the movie. I loved the grainy black and white, like the movie was being filmed on security camera's with audio.  The dialogue was fantastic.  Sharp, witty, filled with pop culture jabs and inside jests.  Dante and Randal were perfect opposites and played their roles beautifully, Dante the submissive weak willed type clerk and Randal, the rude as hell close the store for an hour at noon type clerk.  Throw in the various plots of the movie, the zaniness of their love lives, and two pot dealers named Jay and Silent Bob and you find yourself holding a clever and original film.  Smith definitely delivered strong and hard with this film, which I consider one of the best comedies of the nineties.

reviews.review_title: A film about clerks and their everyday life style.
reviews.content: Kevin Smith's Clerks is by far in my humble opion one of the best comdeys out there. It may just be a bunch of dick and fart jokes but at least they have meaning unlike some of the piece of crap comedys like as Zoolander.The main plot of the film is a simple but good one. Who doesn't wonder what kind of a horrible day clerks must have just sitting at a counter waiting to serve you? The movie follows Dante Hicks through his crazy day of playing hockey on the store roof,visiting a funeral home, and straightening out his messed up love life. With him for the ride are two stoners, known to other as Jay(Jason Mewes) and Silent Bob(Kevin Smith), the clerk next door Randal, and a bunch of unpredictable shoppers. Scott Moser,the producer who plays three different roles is quite funny to watch as the egg upsest guidance counselor.Follow Kevin Smith as he takes you into the crazy world of being a clerk.

In the age of the highly critical film viewers, I'm suprised so many people liked 'Clerks', as I did.  And for those of you who didn't: who cares about the poor acting?  Does that actually make you lose interest or make the plot any less than it is?  The script is awesome.  The daily controversy between the characters (Star Wars, Relationships, Jobs) is very interesting.  The character development is great as well.  I congratulate Kevin Smith on his ability to create a very good film with minimal resources.

reviews.review_title: ''This job would be great if it wasn't for the f**king customers'' Randal Graeves
reviews.content: It's amazing how a film that was shot in grainy b&w and a budget that was mostly made up of maxed out credit cards could sum up an entire generation of people in their early twenties...it was due to the very clever script by writer/director Kevin Smith who would later go on to make Chasing Amy/Dogma/Zach and Miri make a porno. The story is simple,two clerks working in a Quick stop/video store,Dante(Brian 0' Halloran) who constantly complains about he hates his job and yet lets people walk all over him and believes himself to be a victim while Randal(Jeff Anderson) chooses to lash out at the customers. This simple story of two people working in a dead end job works because of the very funny banter exchanged between our two main characters..particularly Randal whose cynical outlook on life often ends with hilarity as his constant abuse of the customers and his long winded conversations about topics such as Star Wars come to mind.I would recommend this to anyone who does not have a problem with bad language as this is in my opinion a Modern Classic.

Okay so a film about two people who work in a shop all day, may sound boring, but the few of you who go out and watch this will be pleasantly surprised. This film is the best of acclaimed director Kevin Smith's films. With a tiny budget this film proved that money isn't always everything, and showed off Kevin Smith brilliant writing skills. The now classic razor sharp dialogue is unbeaten, even today.

As a low budget comedic film, Kevin Smith is quite the man.  He shows a day of a convenience store worker and a video store worker in its funniest form. There is no set plot, because different things are happening all the time. From hockey on the roof to cutting work to go to a funeral to discussing the ethics of Star Wars, Clerks will continue to keep you laughing.  Filmed in black 'n white, it gives the feel more of a documentary than a movie, which I think is better than the movie feel.  One of the funniest movies I've ever seen.  If you've ever worked at a convenience store, even if you don't like the movie, you'll be able to to appreciate how accurate it can be.

Given the direction Kevin Smith takes with his later movies and his self confessed sequence of "dick and fart jokes" you might be forgiven for thinking Clerks was made by someone else entirely. If you are expecting more of the 'zany' adventures of Jay and Silent Bob then give this a miss but if you go in with an open mind you will find it to be one of the funniest indie movies of all time. The two main characters are Dante and Randall, who work in the Quick Stop convenience and R.S.T. videos stores respectively, and the film follows their exploits through one working day (Dante isn't supposed to working though). Where Smith really succeeds is in his observational humour ; Dante talking with his girl friend about how easy it is for women to get their man off or Randall's indignation when a customer tricks him in the video store these scenes are not only funny but are easier to identify with than a fat guy and a thin guy kidnapping a monkey. This is a film made by an average guy about average guys for average guys fully deserves it place in the top 250.

reviews.review_title: Open your mind to a ground breaking independent film.
reviews.content: Kevin Smith begins a Trilogy of tales following the lives of a local New Jersey town.  This one focuses on a Quick Stop attendant, Dante, who works on his day off and the myriad of people, including his girlfriend, a neighbor video store owner Randall and a multitude of of customers including the infamous loitering stoner duo fowl mouthed Jay and the ever silent Silent Bob.  An amazingly funny film that introduces us to a whole new universe of New Jersey residents and how they all tie in not only with each other but as well as his follow up movies.  This movie is a prerequisite for Mallrats, Chasing Amy and the grand finale Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back. You may need to watch it more than once to catch this heavily dialog-ed movie that IS the M.O. of Kevin Smith.

reviews.review_title: Best movie ever made for 28 grand!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: A super hilarious laugh at what the people who serve you really think about you, being in the public service line of work it hits home. We cant stand the public, now go home and leave us alone. Kevin Smith is a genius..... nuff said!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Accurate and hilarious portrayal of life
reviews.content: Kevin Smith's "Clerks" is so simple, it's beautiful. Filmed in black and white and paid for by Smith selling his comic book collection (and later bought it back using money made from the movie), this movie is like none other. Perhaps one reason I'm so drawn to this movie is that I work in a video store, and believe me, the Randals and Dantes of the world truly do exist. Randal says things to irate customers that I and my fellow co-workers would kill to say. While this movie may be filled to the brim with crude humor and sexual innuendo, it's not exaggerated or over-done: it's reality. And that's one thing that makes this movie so great...it's so funny, yet it's so real and accurate...so, dare I say, human. Honestly...how many of you would love to close the store for awhile just to play hockey on the roof? How many of you might say yes when asked to come on your day off, yet sit there and complain all day that you're working on your day off? Kevin Smith has the ability to capture human emotion so wonderfully, yet he entwines it so well with jokes and comedy, and out pops this fantastically funny movie. This film, along with all of Smith's other works, is a hilarious movie that is perfect for any occasion, with a group of friends or alone.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies I've ever seen!
reviews.content: This film proves that you don't need that Hollywood fancy stuff to do an awesome outstanding movie like this one.Black and white, 2 or 3 different scenarios, the cast is composed by mainly friends... but it works perfectly, you just can't stop laugh! In just 1 hour and a half, they show you all kinds of the funniest annoying customers you can possibly imagine, while Dante and Randall philosophize about all kinds of girls-silly-porno-sex-starwars stuff.The soundtrack costs more than the movie itself! Exclusive songs from The Jesus Lizard, Alice In Chains, Soul Asylum, Corrosion Of Conformity and Bad Religion are playing while you keep laughing and laughing.One of the funniest movies I've ever seen, everyone should try it

While this movie has foul language, it is still fantastic.  This movie felt very raw, but very good.  Jay and Silent Bob are funny, but don't nearly play the roll they do in some of the other Kevin Smith movies.  If your in for a laugh, and talk of sex acts doesn't bother you, then check this out.

reviews.review_title: Why didn't I think of this?
reviews.content:
In the first of Kevin Smith's View Askew movie, we are treated to a movie almost any one could make. Like the old saying goes, a good idea makes you think, "Hey, that's a good idea." A great idea makes you think, "Damn, now why didn't I think of that?" The movie was cost $24,000 to make, after hours, at a store Smith worked at.
