You just don't get any more indie then that.But I digress. The actual movie is based on the Divine Comedy by Dante, so one of the main characters is named Dante. Dante is played to a slacker perfect by Brian O' Halloran. The basic idea of the movie is that Dante is having a bad day. He has to go in to work when he doesn't have to, gets pelted with cigs, and finds out his girlfriend has performed the french perversion on 37 men. All of this happens in the first 15-20 min.
The script is one of the funniest I've ever, and while watching the movie it is tempting to wonder whatr the movie would have been like while a "name" cast and a bigger budget.The movie does have some flaws. The cast is an assortment of Smith's friends, so the acting is only so-so. Also, because of the small budget, Walt Flannagin has to play like, 6 bit parts. Also, if you are looking for artsy direction, you will be disapointed. Smith is not a visual director, most of his scences are long verbal shots, only sometimes interrupted by the antics of Jay and Silent Bob. (Silent Bob is played by director Smith) Other the that, this is a really great movie.

***Clerks***Clerks is about 2 "slackers" that work at a convenience store and a video rental store,every day they get up and go to work and have to tolerate every person that comes in. So they basically lead a normal life and one day things are different. Dante get's waken up on Saturday by a phone call from his boss saying that he has to go to work today,and Dante being the push-over he is goes inRandal comes in to work late and doesn't do his job all he does is watch movies and talks with Dante all day.Now just add some funeral's,hockey,porn,underage smoking and Two Drug dealers by the name's of Jay and Silent Bob and you have Clerks.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest films ever made, Kevin Smith is a Genious
reviews.content: I think that all Kevin Smith movies are five of the greatest movies ever made.  Kevin Smith is a Genious.  I think that Brian O'Halloran and Jeff Anderson are great actors and I don't understand why they haven't put into major films since "Clerks."  It is a smart and funny look at common day people and that is why it's so amazing.  The people don't do anything spectacular they just live their lives like everyday people.  That with Kevin Smith's amazing dialouge is great.  I think that Jason Mewes is perfect for the part and the Jay and Silent Bob characters are great.  Jay is an idol for all stoners.  The movie is funny but also makes you look at life.

reviews.review_title: A true look at everyday life.
reviews.content: I've been a Kevin smith fan for quite some time now...ever since my friends made me watch Dogma. But surprisingly enough, all I've ever seen of Clerks was the cartoon series, until today. For the most part, I believe those who did not like this film, really did not understand what it was. They are the kind of people who need action every five seconds, in bright vivid color. People need to understand Kevin did this with a limited budget (27,000 something).Back to my original point, anyone who's worked a dead end job can relate to this film. It literally portrays the everyday antics society faces today. Plus it helps to have worked in a quick stop like store. I believe, after all, that Kevin Smith did work at that particular Quick Stop (not sure though, and don't quote me on it).All in all, if you're a film student, have a good sense of humor, and/or want to kill some time, go watch Clerks.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest films of our time...
reviews.content: "Clerks" is one of the greatest films of our time. I know: it's a bold statement, but this film proves that you can make a great movie without spending millions and millions of dollars.The charm in "Clerks" lies with its unique look (courtesy of uber-cinematographer Dave Klein) and some of the best dialogue ever (written by film-genius Kevin Smith). Where the film lacks in expensive visuals, it makes up with in extraordinary dialogue. While the speech may be crude, it is realistic. It shows what a couple of 20-something convenience and video store workers talked about in the early 90s.Without going into anymore detail (and possibly spoiling the film for future fans), all I can say is that "Clerks" is a 10 in my book!

reviews.review_title: A MUST SEE FOR ALL EMPLOYEES THAT ARE CLERKS AT MOVIE STORES!
reviews.content: This movie completely and perfectly describes the details of over the counter life as a clerk! It is one of the funniest movies i have ever seen.Kevin Smith is a very talented and insightful director with a great since of humor.The movie does look very corny and low budget, but a little movie trivia, Kevin Smith sold his comic book collection to fund this movie. Then after the movie became a hit he bought his comic books back! I currently work for blockbuster video and life is exactly like this movie! Thanks to this movie some of us are thinking about holding a hockey game on the roof of the store when we quit!I recommend this movie to every person who works as a clerk in a convenience store, or in a video store. This movie for those who don't work in mediocre place such as this will explain to you why we are the way we are!

"Clerks" is the cheapest great film I've seen. By sheer determination and nothing short of wild luck, this film:(1) got written, (2) got shot, (3) got screened,(4) got discovered, and(5) got distributed! Each step was a mini-miracle. The film launched the luminous career of writer/producer Kevin Smith and, most importantly, it gave mythical status to that lovable duo Jay and Silent Bob! "Clerks" is a miracle!

reviews.review_title: Clerks Is Only Funny To Jerks, by Nelson Donley
reviews.content: I won't waste too many words on this movie. The theme seems to be that clerks may have to wait on you, but they generally do not like you. It seems to mock British humor, but only in the crudest of ways.This is a low budget film, but is not nearly as entertaining as even the worst Ed Wood production. It is also a very disorganized film; a discombobulation of filthy scenes that can only invoke disgust in the intelligent mind.This disgusting film will turn your stomach, if not anything else. WARNING: Life is very short-- Don't waste time on th is film. You'd be better off watching paint dry on a cold day.

I thought i had seen all the cult films that were out there until i picked this up. At first i was a little disappointed but then that quickly changed! This is now the best one i've seen! never a dull moment after the first few minutes. I totally recommend this film if like me, are planning to pursue a independent film-making career! 10 out of 10! Directed by Kevin SmithRated 'R' On Appeal for Extensive use of sexual content and strong language.Bottom Line: Rent then Buy.

A lot of people are coming down on this movie for its low budget and poor acting. I'm not going to say they're wrong on that. However, this movie is the first independent film to really made me want to look at others. Many of the jokes are so dry, I feel a lot of people skip over them at first. Kevin Smith has a unique way of writing jokes that actually become funnier the more you hear them. The dialogue is intelligent and witty if you take the time to listen. You won't find laughter tracks here.

reviews.review_title: Follow me and I will make you fishers of film.
reviews.content: These is one of my key picks for hilarious comedy with a morbid aftertone. Gotta see to believe it.

The reason for this is simple and can be summerized in one word-- oevre. This man has created a series of works that speak to a certain segment of population, one that is searching for a why, and whose mantra and philosophy is "I'm not even supposed to be here today!" as dante sums up repeatedly. Wait. The above paragraph sounds a lot like a load of hooey, but I really think that "Clerks" is the beginning of an excellent series that transcends the usual fate of sequels, in that "mallrats" and "chasing amy" don't just cough up the same hackneyed formula that made the first movie big. "Clerks" is excellently done for a low-budget film, and tells its story in a manner which is both entertaining and thought-provoking, at least to me. Plus it's in black and white, which is always fun, and Dante looks good with his facial hair-- always a plus...

Not an earth-shattering movie, but an excellent example of what can be done on a limited budget.  An inspiration to would-be filmmakers.And a great cult film.  I may never tire of it.I give it 7/10., but that low a rating is really only because of some of the editing/directing goofs, and the use of black & white, which i thought was unnecessary - a bit too "artsy" for my tastes, because this was supposed to be a common movie about a common person.  Maybe a "muted color" film would have been best.

reviews.review_title: A Rarity these days, a funny American film.
reviews.content: A simple but brilliant look at life as a shop worker in America. The two main characters bluff their way through  an array of hilarious situations ranging from milk to death.

reviews.review_title: It's not a movie, its a lifestyle.
reviews.content: I absolutely loved Clerks. It portrays a day in the life of a person who has to work directly with the public, and how he barely maintains his sanity through it all.  It shows the audience what it is like dealing directly with the public and exactly what they have to put up with and go through. This movie was made for people who work in fast food restaurant, video stores, gas stations, and overall crappy jobs. Dante is the person we all have to be in order to keep out jobs, but Randal is the person we wish we could all be. This movie is the best and most realistic portrayal of what out generation is all about and will always be remembered by.

Clerks is a great movie, especialy for those with ties to the world of retail.  It exposes the hardships we have to go through.  I briefly worked in a convenience store, and now working in a video store, really does accuratly portray that which occurs in our live daily.  Although I can't say I behave like Randal, it is what every single one of us feels like sometimes.   A MUST SEE MOVIE.

reviews.review_title: One of the best Independent Films I have ever seen.
reviews.content: Kevin Smith is Brilliant.  The Dialogue in this film is some of the most real comedy to come across the silver screen in decades.  An intelligent cast in an intelligent setting.  I loved it.

reviews.review_title: Just Because they serve you doesn't mean they like you
reviews.content: If you have ever worked in retail in any form you must see this movie. The funniest movie I have seen in a long time. Kevin Smith is brilliant.

This is the funniest and best written movie I have ever seen. I laughed so hard my nose bled. The humor could be described as Seinfeld on acid -- an stylized, witty, chaotic movie about absolutely nothing. A must see.

I have to thank my friend Susie for getting me this movie for my  birthday. Having no idea what it was about, I still watched it. Even though I had to shut it off...so offensive the first time around. Watched it a second time and found it VERY funny. Great movie for a first time director. BRAVO! Can't wait for Dogma!

reviews.review_title: Clerks has to be one of the greatest independent films ever made
reviews.content: A stunning performance led by Kevin Smith and his band of teamsters is what made Clerks.  He takes something out of real life and twists it into something that you would never think of.  Of course anyone could make a screenplay containing a quick shop-esc feel to it, but only Mr. Smith could think of something as wild as a girl having sex with a dead guy in a bathroom, and only he could think of a couple of drug dealers that stand around and try to make a quick sale off of slack jawed yokels from a small New Jersey town.  Jay and Silent Bob?  That's comedy in its purist form. I'm sure anyone could come up with a long haired metal head/gangster with trendy pop culture quotes, but I don't think anyone could come up with a drug dealer that does not talk, but when he does he "makes a huge impact" on the person he is saying it to.  Kevin, can't wait for DOGMA, keep up the good work.

This movie is a wonderful piece of New Jersey culture. Anyone who is from NJ and watches it, inevitably points to the screen at some point and says "I've been there!" or "I know that guy!". This can be said for all 3 movies in Kevin Smith's brilliant New Jersey Trilogy (Clerks, Mallrats, and Chasing Amy). Although it must be stated that not all New Jerseyans do not: a) work in convenience stores, b) work in video stores, or c) loiter/solicit drugs outside of convenience/video stores, the philosophies and attitudes presented by the characters in the movie so strongly pull from our lives with delicious accuracy.

a must see for anyone who has ever worked in a retail environment. well done and darkly funny. even better on dvd where the film ends the way the director wanted it to. low budget film gem.great soundtrack adds to the film. well filmed on the streets of jersey.

I think Clerks is definitely one of the best movies I've ever seen in my life. It really shows that to make a great movie, you don't need lots of special effects (The movie was even in black and white). It had a great story and throughout the movie I was hoping it would never end. I also enjoyed Mallrats and Chasing Amy, but not as much as Clerks.

Yes, this is one of the best.  I saw Clerks when it was first released on video and knew it was instantly my favourite movie of all-time.  I love the Godfather, Star Wars, Shawshank, and Searching for Bobby Fischer because, like Clerks, they are all great movies for their time and in their realm. Clerks is the best low-budget, non-colour, no one famous movie I have ever seen.  The dialogue is indescribably excellent and the scenery is as simple as it can be.  Kevin Smith is a literary genius and Anderson plays the best friend up to a tee.  Many will tell you that this movie has messages, but I say this.  If you're sick of ultra-special effects and are looking for a fantasticly entertaining comedy, then pick up Clerks. Hey, just because they serve you, doesn't mean they like you.

reviews.review_title: The penny-wise movie that began the snow-ball...
reviews.content: Kevin Smith. 1994. Fresh out of film school (yes, he went). A film in black and white framed with a 16mm camera. A budget not even sufficient for a car purchase. A multi-credited cast (see previous budget comment). And a script full of witty bar-stool jokes with language that would ban you from grandma's house forever.The Result: Instant Cult ClassicClerks is Kevin Smith's theatrical debut (50 screens count, right?) and hits a chord with today's "tweener"-aged crowd. The far-from-Baby-Boomers, but not quite Gen-Xers get the most out of this flick. Throw in a high school degree and your enjoyment level increases ten-fold.For a movie with such crude puns, the dialogue that runs aplenty in between the one-liners is so clever it demands several trips to the video store. Just make the purchase and save the effort; it definitely deserves a spot in your own collection.New Jersey natives will love the film's various homages, but they are only the icing on the proverbial cake. The conclusion of the film leaves you wondering just how you had such a good time with a "day in the life of" plot. After trying Kevin Smith's other works: Mallrats, Chasing Amy, Dogma, and Jay & Silent Bob Strike Back, you will better understand. He finds plots (maybe except Mallrats), develops characters, and even moves the camera. Hey, he even grabbed School Ties's & Dazed and Confused's Ben Affleck before he was drilling holes in the moon. The man's got an eye for this film thing folks, watch his stuff and prove me wrong.He also had his creative hands on Drawing Flies, A Better Place, Good Will Hunting, & Vulgar.Watch Clerks and learn the double meaning of the Summary above. Kevin Smith is definitely on a roll and if the film world is smart, they'll step aside and let him lead.

reviews.review_title: A film that isn't afraid to rely on human verbal communication instead of special effects
reviews.content: Its refreshing to see a director take a script that is so simple in its premise and use it is such a novel and convincing manner. The way that the characters are brought to life in this grim modern day portrayal of convinence store behaviour. The film doesn't even seem to follow a script, instead almost fools the views in to thinking that a security camera has just filmed these people in there everyday behaviour, (even though it could be said some of the situations are slightly out there). I congratulate Kevin Smith of a fine tale of worker day blues, while mixing in element of good music, pop culture and damn amusing situations. Those who don't like it... I scoff (A pack of savages in this town)

When I first seen this film I watch it through a friends recommendation after he had talked about the "Cousin Walter" scene constantly I liked the film but it wasn't until about a year later that I went back again and I loved it. There are no bad things in this film from Jay and Silent Bob through to Dante and Randal's Monologues this is one highly enjoyable film rent, buy, steal anything to see this film.

reviews.review_title: A Daring First Effort by Kevin Smith
reviews.content: In this, Kevin Smith's directorial debut, he really shines by showing off that you don't need a whole bunch of special effects to make a movie great. The one driving force in this movie is the witty dialogue that never seems to stop coming at you.  I think that the fact that it's in B&W kind of enhances the bleakness of the Quick Stop(though unintentional, he filmed it in B&W for budget reasons).  You will not be disappointed after seeing this wonderful flick!

Hello. All i would like to say is that this movie is superb. Before i saw this movie I had no interest in black and white films. After I saw it, I realized that color does not determine if a movie is good or not, but by how well the director shows his artistic view and ingenius talent. As anyone can tell, this movie is a classic. Although in black and white, it still has a really funny story-line and good actors to portray the characters, not to mention the infamous Jay and the ever-loving Silent Bob. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who wants a good laugh, or wants to see film-making at its finest.

reviews.review_title: Great independent movie, great writing, ok direction...
reviews.content: Kevin Smith's first film, independently financed by himself, is an excellent movie.  Great writing, as well as likable and funny characters make this movie truly memorable.  While the direction is only ok, this movie still warrants a placing as one of my all time favorites.  Besides, what great directorial techniques can one pull off inside a convenience/video store when you only have enough money for one take of each scene?  I have to give Smith and the actors a lot of credit for making this such a great movie. If you liked this movie check out Smith's other movies: "Mallrats" (which takes place before this one), "Chasing Amy", "Dogma", and the forthcoming "Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back".

Dialogue is the most important strength that a film can have, and Clerks has it.  The acting is great, especially for first-time actor Jeff Anderson, who plays Randal extremely well.  If you haven't seen it, I don't know what you're waiting for.

this is Kevin smiths best film. Its just so basic, its amazing. The film which launched a thousand careers, and a thousand other references in the next four of his films. Just watch this film, critics loved it, and if you have a brain that can think round slightly intelligent comedy, you will to.

Anyone who has worked in a convenience store can relate to the odd interactions with customers.Language is a bit rough for "pure viewers" but this is one of the funniest movies I have seen. So many great lines...Although you may not be familiar with the cast, that shouldn't stop you from seeing this movie!

reviews.review_title: Dante my girlfriend sucked 37 d**s,Customer in shop In a row?
reviews.content: This film is a brilliant look at whats to come for Kevin Smith. This film was the 1st in a series which ended this year with Jay and Silent bob strike back. This film gives us a funny look at the life of two cd store clerks named Dante and Randal. The funniest part in this film is the part where Dante finds out the sexual history of his girlfriend Veronica. This film was made on a very low budget and it just goes to show that films that are made on a low budget are usually better than the average popcorn blockbuster. 9 out of 10

Take two guys working loser type jobs.  Extremely self-involved, but understanding to the same extreme... or just plain extreme.Kevin Smith takes his ability to take extremely recognizable situations and insert ideal "one-liners" over and over.  Each and every line in this pseudo-mockumentary is one to remember for both it's humor and it's hard-core truth. (as he Smith does so well)Just go rent it... forget that, buy it.  If you're even interested in seeing it (why else would you have looked for information on it) and have enjoyed ANY of his other films, you'll want to add it to your collection.I'll be the first to admit that, considering this is one of the first of his many films, it is quite vulgar; however, if you can get past the use of questionable language and take it simply as common use of "improper" words used to express the degree of emotion... you won't stop laughing.Tie it in with the rest of his films, and you'll say.. hey, wasn't that the <guy/girl> in <insert film name here>? etc....

Clerks - what a fantastic movie!  I loved it through and through.  Follow the zany adventures of two convenience store clerks in Red Bank, NJ as they go through the craziest day of their lives!  From funerals, to rooftop hockey games, to things so outrageous I can't mention them here, they have a hilarious adventure well worth the cost of a rental, if not a buy.Kevin Smith writes and directs this comedy extravaganza, and also appears as "Silent Bob".  Brian O'Hallaran and Jeff Anderson also do a bang-up job as the title characters, Dante and Randal.  With Jason Mewes as the zany "Jay", you can be sure that the cast is on a one-way course to hilarity!  Matt Crawford shines, with his phenomenal performance as "Angry Crowd at Door" - I don't think I'd be exaggerating his performance with the phrase: "Oscar's got a new butt to kiss!"

I know most everyone out there is in love with this film from Kevin Smith. And I must say that Kevin Smith is incredible and almost everything about this movie I loved.  I mean his writing genius is definitely on display as well as all of his other talents of which I am sure you all are aware. However, I cannot get over how much I dislike Dante.  I mean the whole time all he does is whine and moan and feel sorry for himself.  True some comments and some scenes were funny and intellectually amazing, but I got so tired of listening to him speak that I cannot bear to watch it again.  So that is to say, everything about this movie is all its cracked up to be, but lighten up Dante cause I am going insane with all your moaning.

This is, by far, the worst damn movie I've ever seen in my life. How could anyone like this trash? The only thing that was done well with this film was some of the dialogue. It had OK writing at parts...but the acting, filming, the story, everything was terrible. It tried to be too realistic. I couldn't stand listening to Dante's or Randall's voice after a while, they were so friggin' annoying. I can't stand Jay either, he's a worthless character. Silent Bob is cool, cuz I like Kevin Smith, and the rest of his movies are good except for this one. Everyone kept saying to me "ya gotta see clerks, ya gotta see clerks." So I saw it and almost died of boredom and nausea. It was so ridiculously retarded. All the pointless conversations about girlfriends, movies, and other crap was so boring...I've heard all this a thousand times. The whole movie is basically that fruit Dante whining about everything and that monotoned punk Randall giving his overdescriptive insight. Pass on this one. You'd have better entertainment unclogging a sink than watching Clerks. A repulsive "movie."

reviews.review_title: One of the Most Inventive Movies Ever
reviews.content: Alright, I came into this movie purely based on a trusted friend's recommendation.  Boy was I surprised, this movie has great acting by complete unknowns.  The Film is extremely well written by Kevin Smith and I think that it's the best movie in the Criterion Collection (Clerks, Mallrats, Chasing Amy, Dogma &  Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back).Brian O'Halloran plays a very kind and gullible character in Dante Hicks and Jeff Anderson is great as the sly and carefree Randall Graves.  Then with Jay and Silent Bob just outside the Quik stop you have an immediate cast of believable and likeable characters.Clerks starts out interesting and just keeps getting better.  It has many twist and turns that you really don't see coming.  Not only that but the way things happen is incredible in it's own sense.  The ending is also great but make sure, that if you can, to pick it up on DVD for the alternate ending. I give it ***** stars out of 5.  Definitely worth seeing if you're from Jersey or if you enjoy a slightly darker comedy.

I've seen Dogma, and I've seen Chasing Amy. After them i started to hunt Clerks, found it, loved it. Yes, it's cheap, it's black & white, it has amateur actors, but it's the funniest movie i've seen in ages. It's the first appearance of Jay (sidekick to Silent Bob) and Silent Bob (sidekick to Jay), it has one of the sharpest and funniest dialogue I've ever heard. If you like good movies, you'll gonna LOVE this one...

Simply one of the true greats of independant cinema and the 90's.So original, its such a refreshing change to see a movie that isnt up its own ass or isnt afraid to take the p*** out of itself. I love this film, it captures the true feelings of a generation not often understood by filmmakers.-THANK YOU KEVIN SMITH!!!

Retail sucks.  thats basically the message of "Clerks", and I agree. another really cool film that deals with similar material is a short called "Budget Liquor", which chronicles the daily antics of a Liquor store clerk/philosopher of life.

reviews.review_title: Smith(and Mewes to a lesser extent)rules!
reviews.content: Why so funny, sir? I mean, the idea of a movie about two convenience store clerks deserves an Oscar in and of itself. Kevin Smith is a comical genius who as Silent Bob, is the backbone of this low-budget phenomenon. Dante and Randall may be the main characters, but without Jay and Silent Bob, would there even be any Clerks? Think about it.

reviews.review_title: $24,000 was enough to make the best comedy of the decade
reviews.content: In 1994, nobody knew who Kevin Smith was.  Jay and Silent Bob were not yet stoner heroes.  Smith's films had not yet achieved the fanbase nor the level of infamy they now have...since this was, of course, his first movie.  On a mere budget of $24,000, Kevin Smith made Clerks, a movie he wrote and directed, and yeah, was featured in as an actor as well.  The results? Brilliance.Brian O'Halloran and Jeff Anderson play Dante and Randal, respectively, two intelligent but slacker-ish guys in their early 20s.  Dante works in the Kwik Stop, a convenience store, and Randal works in a video store adjescent to it.  Dante is the protagonist of the film, as it is his troubles with the insane patrons of the store and his relationships that form the center conflicts.  His buddy Randal is more or less along for the ride to provide his always entertaining comments and insights, and to kick some sense into Dante when necessary.  The film follows them over the course of one day, not a particularly good day in the life of Dante Hicks.  A whole bunch of stuff happens to them, and I won't give anything away, but suffice it to say-- well, screw it-- they play hockey on the roof of the Kwik Stop.  Yes. Don't worry, I didn't give much away.Jason Mewes and Smith himself also appear as Jay and Silent Bob, the aforementioned stoners who deal outside of the Kwik Stop.  They serve as an interesting contrast to Dante and Randal, not to mention providing numerous funny moments.  And yes, they do end up acting as a voice of reason.The movie is absolutely hilarious throughout, and whether we are laughing at the ridiculousness of Dante and Randal's situation, the unique dialogue between the characters, or the wacky events that transpire, we are laughing... though, there is most definitely a dramatic element to the film, and a powerful realization for many (young) viewers such as myself when we see a little bit of Dante in all of us; his romantic confusion, his inability to incite change, etc.  Throw in Smith's hilariously pretentious scene titles ("denouement"), and Smith's comic writing talents, and you've got yourself the best comedy of the 90s.
A great film. Very original, hysterical, and cool. Loved the dialogue throughout the whole film. i really recommend this to everyone

I myself thought this movie was spectacular. I loved Jay and Silent Bob, and Randal is the funniest in the movie. Without this movie the whole New Jersey Chronicles wouldn't survive. All the people in Clerks are mentioned in Chasing Amy, and without Jay and Silent Bob's introduction, Mallrats wouldn't be that great unless you knew them already. Dogma used Jay and Silent Bob, and had a newscaster named Hicks (Dante' Hicks). Then in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, all the old charecters are shown again. So none of these movies would be as good without Clerks.

reviews.review_title: Amazing what you can buy on a credit card
reviews.content: Kevin Smith shows us through this film, the kind of film one makes when you have to make movies. While most people put movie tickets on credit cards, Mr Smith is reported to have made this movie by charging it to plastic, then selling it later. It is one day in the life of two friends, if we take the time to notice all the humor in life. It is not a pretty film, but the dialogue delivers laughs, and cast that either are their rolls - or are perfectly cast.

reviews.review_title: Wonderfully well told tale of workin man blues.
reviews.content:
When all is said and done this movie really tells a great story, bottom line. And that is all that it needs to be one of MY favorite films ever.
With Randal and Dante's foul mouthed conversing blended in with some very colorful antics, this film really tells the tale that every man feels every morning. The tale of having to get up and go to work! With all this even, somehow, a love story is also told. The relationship of best friends and girlfriends is told through wonderfully nasty humor...AND I LOVED IT.

reviews.review_title: A kind of quirky hilarious movie.
reviews.content: This movie was better than i thought it would be. I automatically stereo-type every black and white movie i see a trailer for. The only two movies I've made an exception for were to kill a mocking bird and Clerks. It had all types of comedy, one-liners, long jokes with one punch line, silent, and suddle. They got the best people for the parts too, it felt like they were really feeling how they were acting (and they probably were). It was odd at times, but they squeezed in a joke every place they could. Overall this movie wouldn't be right for everyone, but if you have a twisted sence of comedy, and tolerance of this movie being under-budget, then this would be perfect for you.

For all the continuity errors, fumbled lines, and ridiculous jokes, there are ten great memorable parts of this movie.  The characters are my favorites of any movie; no others compare in quirkiness and ass-backwardness(?) to the people that come into Quick Stop and RTS.  I hope to someday make a film that comes close to what this production has accomplished. -Pengo-

reviews.review_title: Clerks -- the best film you've never seen ...
reviews.content: «Clerks» is one of the best movies I've ever seen. The thing I like the most is that it shows the real American life in a town: boring, without great prospects, not the sparkling American dream shown in Hollywood blockbusters. Kevin Smith's black humor and harsh irony is perfect -- some of my friends almost speak using only jokes from his movies. It could sound strange, but the film gives a lot of food for thought: you are young, but what to do with the rest of your life. Go to college, or continue in a Mac job in a small shop, where every customer is a wired nightmare. This is an honest story about clerks: «Just Because They Serve You... Doesn't Mean They Like You», it denies the main idea of American culture of consumption, namely «the customer is always right». He is so talented to create a one and a half hour movie, not one of those three hour monsters which are made now. Every scene is brilliant -- you won't regret a single minute spent watching this movie.

reviews.review_title: Very Unique and Well Done Film
reviews.content: I had never heard of Kevin Smith until about a year ago, when a friend of mine brought Dogma over for me to watch.  I thought that the film was well done and I had to learn more about the directors other projects, so I bought Clerks and I thought that it was great.  I strongly recommend the movie.

reviews.review_title: I love all Kevin Smith films!
reviews.content: But I identify so much with Clerks its not funny...I am a server so I obviously deal with people almost in the same passion. This movie makes me laugh so much. Kevin's work only gets better but I think all good things had to start somewhere and I believe it was definitely CLERKS!

Kevin Smith's "Clerks" is one of my favorite movies of all time. "Clerks" has everything,A good story,A good cast and all and all it's just a great comedy."Clerks" was written and directed by Kevin Smith and this is the first installment in his askewniverse and in my opinion I think this is his best.Ever since I have seen Clerks I have been hooked on it and everything else Kevin Smith made.It stars Brian o' Halloran as Dante Hicks a convenience store worker who hates his job but takes it a little seriously,Next door is the video store which is run by Randal Graves (Played by Jeff Anderson)Randal is obviously a slackerand doesn't really do his job but bugs Dante at his."Clerks" is amazing and is one movie you can watch over and over again and never get bored of it.This movie proves that dialogue is great,Practically every conversation is entertaining and funny.Dante and Randal are the masters of conversation!**** out of ****

This film stands as a testament to the notion that storyline and plot are not essential to great filmmaking. Not a few people may be disappointed with this production which seems to go nowhere, or which seems patchwork-style or poorly put together. However, "Clerks." is not about plot; it's not about a gripping, innovative, original tale which leaves you breathtaken. And in that respect, it's like most of Kevin Smith's films.The beautiful aspect to this film is the sharp and witty dialogue which permeates it from start to finish. Punctuated by highly amusing anecdotal mini-dramas and Kubrick-esque scene titles (compare "2001"), the streams of conversation which can only originate in a quirky and intelligent brain are brilliantly delivered by Brian O'Halloran and Jeff Anderson.Periodic appearances by Jay and S.B. blatantly characterize this film as a Smith, but it is the sharp reparté and fearlessness to deal with uneuphemistic and outright twisted humour which place the Smith brand on "Clerks."A must-see if you're at least content, if not happy, to sit through a film whose main plus point is its dialogue. If you are a Die Hard fan, however, perhaps you should give this one a miss. Sheer brilliance.

reviews.review_title: can easily watch over and over
reviews.content: This is one of few movie that I can watch repeatedly and never get sick of.This shows a good movie can be made through just having fun characters and interesting dialogue. This is my second favorite kevin smith movie behind the sequel clerks 2, but I can watch this movie more often than clerks 2. I cant believe the pure enjoyment that comes out of just hearing two people talk,leave it to kevin to make that happen. I of course think the movie was well written, many people seem to complain about the acting, but really the acting never bothered me that much in the sense that I did not think It was that bad, but I can tell a difference In Jeff andersons performance in between sequels and in zack and miri. The guy has gotten a lot better. Well, anyway clerks rocks.10/10
